markdown:
<title level="1" right="Cantrip 1" pfs="Standard">
[Imaginary Weapon](/Spells.aspx?ID=1142)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Attack" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=15" />
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Evocation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=65" />
<trait label="Force" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=75" />
<trait label="Psychic" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=430" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Dark Archive](/Sources.aspx?ID=129) pg. 22

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

You create a simple weapon of force. Make a melee spell attack roll against your target's AC. If you hit, you deal 2d8 bludgeoning or slashing damage (your choice). On a critical success, you deal double damage and can choose to detonate your weapon to [push](/Rules.aspx?ID=451) the target 10 feet away from you.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The damage increases by 1d8.

---

<column gap="tiny">
**Amp** You form multiple force weapons to lash out at multiple foes. You make two imaginary weapon Strikes, each against a different target. Your multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until you've made both Strikes.

**Amp Heightened (+1)**
The damage increases by 2d8 instead of 1d8.
</column>
name: Imaginary Weapon
